title: Okay. Why is this champ not gutted yet?
body:
https://vimeo.com/217426509

My position needed some work, seeing as I walked into his face to make sure all my feathers hit, but his ult did 90% of my HP. That's true damage, as well.

I mean, he tanked 3 people for 14 seconds and killed two of them. Hello?

replies.body:
Having watched the video a bunch of times it looks like Darius made a couple good choices and got a bit lucky (outside being so far ahead).

After the cc ends the Darius positions, moving diagonally to the right, so that his Decimate hits both Lux and Irelia on the axe edge for a massive 24% missing health heal. Right before that happens he manages to get Irelia to max bleed stacks which activates his passive _and_ ensures that the very same decimate will also apply max stacks to anyone hit - the Lux. This of course is immediately chained with the max stack dunk onto Lux that gives way for a pretty crucial level up heal and the split second he needs to land the second kill. Had the Decimate missed he wouldn't have healed for as much or had an easy opening on Lux.

Regardless, I can't help but wonder if Darius would have ever left the cc lock if Veig shot out his W before heading off to clear minions.

Yea it's so bad.

and in lane his bleed just makes sure that any trades are completely in his favour.

Still not as broken as Lee though.
Yeah unlike Lee sin, Darius's biggest flaw is being kitted easily, Lee sin on the other hand has pretty much everything in his kit so finding a way to outplay a good lee is pretty difficult.

Dont let him stack passive

Ez pz

I mean by the looks of it, he had 4 levels on you all and was extremely fed. He had 5 items, you had 2. Almost any champ with that huge of a lead can 1v3.

I do it with Renekton, Graves etc. It is especially easy with champs that have built in heals like Darius.
